title: sum of a torch.Tensor return the wong result
body_html:
the sum of a torch.tensor return me a strange result.

Why???

this is my code:
print(result.shape) print(result) print(type(result)) print(result.dtype) print(sum(result)) mysum = 0 for i in result: mysum += i.item() print("Mysum", mysum)

this is the output:
torch.Size([24512]) tensor([ 1, 1, 1, ..., 1, 1, 1], dtype=torch.uint8) <class 'torch.Tensor'> torch.uint8 tensor(80, dtype=torch.uint8) Mysum 15184

80 is not the same of 15184. Why I get different result? what the 80 represents?

Pytorch V0.4.0

Pytorch V0.4.0
body:
the sum of a torch.tensor return me a strange result.

Why???

this is my code:
`
print(result.shape)
print(result)
print(type(result))
print(result.dtype)
print(sum(result))
mysum = 0
for i in result:
    mysum += i.item()
print("Mysum", mysum)
`

this is the output:
`
torch.Size([24512])
tensor([ 1,  1,  1,  ...,  1,  1,  1], dtype=torch.uint8)
<class 'torch.Tensor'>
torch.uint8
tensor(80, dtype=torch.uint8)
Mysum 15184
`

80 is not the same of 15184. Why I get different result? what the 80 represents?

Pytorch V0.4.0
